Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Wild Goat Style, pottery open vessel, possibly a bowl; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with two added white bands; exterior: most of surface lost; traces of white slip; near top, part of undetermined black decoration.
Curator's comments: It is impossible to determine, based on the exterior decoration, to what style the sherd belongs. The lack of interior decoration suggests that it is an early vessel in the Chian series. For other similar sherds, see British Museum 1888,0601.468.d and 1888, 0601.468.o.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2037) (phase 2)
